alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 04 at 1:07PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Marys River Near Deeth affecting Elko County. Humboldt River At Comus affecting Elko County. Humboldt River At Battle Mountain affecting Lander County. Salmon Falls Creek Near Salmon Falls Creek near San Jacinto affecting Elko County. Bruneau River At Rowland affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. For the Marys River...including, Charleston, Deeth...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Lower Humboldt...including Palisade, Battle Mountain, Comus...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Salmon Falls Creek...including Salmon Falls Creek near San Jacinto...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and is forecast to continue. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Humboldt River At Comus. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Minor to moderate lowland flooding throughout the reach. Some rural roads near the river begin to flood. Very minor flooding begins in Winnemucca with storm drain backups, and the lowest parts of town begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 PM PDT Thursday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:15 PM PDT Thursday was 10.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady above flood stage at 10.3 feet. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.4 feet on 04/03/1993. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon at 200 PM PDT.
